intro: Brassica monensis var. petrosa, commonly known as the Chinese kale or gai lan, is a leafy vegetable belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its dark green, tender leaves and thick, edible stalks that are often harvested together. The plant is native to East Asia and is widely cultivated for its nutritional value and culinary versatility. Its leaves are rich in vitamins A, C, and K, as well as dietary fiber. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in cool climates with well-drained soil.
